newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-MATCHES IN THE SPANISH LEAGUE CHAMPIONSHIP.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-MATCHES IN THE SPANISH LEAGUE CHAMPIONSHIP.

text.p: Matches scheduled for the weekened in the Spanish league championship (league standings in parentheses, kick-off times gmt):

New Sevilla coach Julian Rubio brings in several reserve team players and will have to replace suspended midfielders Manuel Jimenez and Robert Prosinecki for a fixture from which his team have come home with a result for the past three years.
Logrones will play a four instead of five man defence at Valencia, where coach Jorge Valdano is still fighting to win the confidence of fans.

Giovanni and Ronaldo return to the Barcelona line-up after sharing Brazil's four goals against Poland in midweek, but playmaker Josep Guardiola is out suspended. Tenerife may see David Nyathi return from injury ahead of Tuesday's vital UEFA Cup clash against Brondby.
Rayo's top scorer Guilherme was rested for Tuesday's 2-0 Cup defeat at Betis, and will return against a newly-inspired Deportivo outfit who will miss suspended defender Paco Jemez.
Sporting have offered a special bonus to try to achieve their first top-flight victory at Compostela, who have recently signed a new contract with Nigerian striker Christopher Ohen.
Otto Konrad and Xavier Aguado are out suspended for Zaragoza, who will look to continue their recovery against a side that have got points from eight of their away games.

Extremadura will be without striker Francisco Garcia and midfielder Pedro Jose Lorenzo. The side has bounced back after signing a trio of Argentine players and have the second-best record of teams in the second round of league games.
Oviedo defender Abel Xavier is suspended while Celta were boosted by the 2-1 away win at Racing Santander in midweek Cup action.
Betis seemed to overcome their nervousness at home in the 2-0 Cup victory over Rayo midweek, but will be without suspended defenders Tomas Olias and Juan Merino and Olias.
A tense atmosphere surrounds the big Basque derby, which could also decide vital UEFA Cup places. Athletic will be without defenders Aitor Karanka and Bixente Lizarazu.

Real will see defenders Fernando Hierroa and Rafael Alkorta return from suspension, but will lose Jose Garcia Calvo the same way, while Espanyol have been wracked by allegations of a 'mole' in the dressing-room after details of a team-talk were leaked.
